perturbation.original_text: In the event that Oceanic Time Warner Cable removes the above content and or terminates this agreement prior to December 31, 2006, Oceanic Time Warner Cable agrees to pay a cancellation fee of Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000) per month multiplied by the number of months remain on the agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event that Oceanic Time Warner Cable removes the above content and or terminates this agreement prior to December 31, 2006, Oceanic Time Warner Cable agrees to pay a cancellation fee of Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000) total, regardless of how many months remain on the agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a fixed cancellation fee that does not scale with the remaining term of the agreement. This could be deemed unconscionable or an unenforceable penalty under contract law, as it may not reasonably reflect the actual damages incurred by Watchit Media due to early termination. The fixed fee does not consider the time remaining on the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding unconscionability and the enforceability of liquidated damages clauses, applicable in most US jurisdictions.

perturbation.original_text: Oceanic Time Warner Cable will include the following disclaimer on the Watchit Content: “The materials shown are for entertainment purposes only and does not provide any guarantees of winning or improving your odds of winning on this program. The rules of the games as shown may not apply to all properties and may change from time to time.”
perturbation.changed_text: Oceanic Time Warner Cable will include the following disclaimer on the Watchit Content: “The materials shown are guaranteed to improve your odds of winning. Watchit Media assumes no responsibility for any losses incurred.”
perturbation.explanation: The original disclaimer protects Oceanic Time Warner Cable from liability related to the gambling content. This change introduces a guarantee of improved odds of winning, which is false and misleading. The secondary part limiting Watchit Media liability does not negate the fact that the first part has already falsely advertised a result from the content.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State and federal laws prohibiting false advertising and deceptive trade practices.

perturbation.original_text: This agreement will be in effect until the end of 2006 and will be evaluated at that time.
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement will be in effect until the end of 2006 and will automatically renew for successive one-year terms unless either party provides written notice of termination at least 15 days prior to the end of the current term.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement expires at the end of 2006. The modification adds an automatic renewal clause with a short 15-day notice period for termination. In many jurisdictions, particularly concerning business-to-business contracts, such short notice periods for automatic renewals are scrutinized and may be deemed unconscionable if they don't provide adequate opportunity for the other party to consider renewal terms. This creates conflict because, depending on the state, the 15 day notice could be considered too short and, therefore, not compliant with the state laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State laws governing automatic renewal clauses in contracts, potentially violating requirements for reasonable notice periods, e.g., laws relating to 'Evergreen Clauses'.
perturbation.location: Paragraph on the term of agreement
